title: How strong of a bond do you share with your father? How often do you have conversations with him? - Quora

response.answer_text: Dear Deepkia, Well it’s too late as of today, but the question is interesting and needs some intervention and flash light on the subject. Normally in our culture, fathers, behaviour has an good impact on children’s life. Right from the birth, they are taught many things but there can ever be not a perfect life, as destiny works equally every where and with every one.! Some fathers are harsh in implementation having no wrong intentions on their children, some are very lovely, so child remains very friendly. Some are more impacted on the phase of diclipine and so on.(DEPENDING UPON THE NATURE) But after certain age, things change, and it is recommended that no sooner the child grows to a particular age the attitudional behavior need to change as the hormonal changes play an important part for the growing child. Now the time has come to treat him friendly, the conversation is the base value of all the relationships. This certifies the standard of the family.

A good bonding exists with my father. As far I have been brought up he is my ideal. He always encourage me, he always trust me. In today's life I used to talk daily with my parents. I always try my best to spend more time with my parents. I think this is the time when they need me like a parents with live care and basic needs. I live you Papa. Most of the parents tries to give a good education to their children but my father has given me best disciples, culture which can't be taught in any school or University.
